Articles.Content:
As usual don't know if this is the write thread.

Anyway my question is Why do people keep saying the 64bit is unstable?

I ask this because I play KSP 64bit and it runs fine for me even when heavily modded.

Can someone shed some light on this?

Thanks in advance

Commander Jebidiah

Edited September 30, 2014 by Commander Jebidiah

Unstable doesn't mean it won't run. It means it may not run on all computers/hardware configurations and even if it does run there may be smaller issues (such as the decoupler force bug which may or may not have been fixed in 24.1)

Right-click menu usually doesn't work for me in 64-bit. It usually works if there's sky behind the part I want to click on, otherwise it doesn't. For me that's enough to make the 64-bit version unusable.

Anyway my question is Why do people keep saying the 64bit is unstable?

It has a number of annoying problems with the game itself and various mods that seem to vary from person to person. It appears to have some sort of memory leak that will eventually crash either KSP or your system if you play continuously long enough. And it definitely causes a loss of functionality with many types of programmable mice that can only be cured by rebooting.
Sounds like you're luckier than most in running 64-bit, congrats.
